alert.note: Alert for Manua; Rose Atoll; Swains Island; Tutuila and Aunuu (American Samoa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS American Samoa (Pago Pago, American Samoa)
info.headline: Hydrologic Outlook issued December 21 at 8:54AM SST by NWS American Samoa
info.description: ...The risk for flooding and scattered landslides increases for the first half of Christmas week... Weak low pressure systems embedded within the South Pacific Convergence Zone is anticipated to pass through the territory Sunday through Tuesday. Although these systems aren`t expected to develop into a Tropical Cyclone, excessive rainfall is possible as they move in the area for the aforementioned timeframe. In addition, an uptick in windspeeds may occur that could loosen up dirt along steep mountain slopes. With saturated grounds from previous rainfall events, low-lying areas are more susceptible to flooding as well landslides to steep mountain slopes. This will be the final Hydrologic Outlook issued for this event. Further hydrologic threat information will be covered by flash flood watches, flash flood warnings and flood advisories as conditions warrant. Keep up to date with the latest forecast information through the Internet (weather.gov/ppg), local media, social media, or NOAA Weather Radio broadcasts.

area.areaDesc: Manua; Rose Atoll; Swains Island; Tutuila and Aunuu
